article_title: High Court Says Muslim Inmate Can Keep Beard
article_text:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court on Tuesday unanimously ruled a religious-freedom law permits a Muslim convict to grow a half-inch beard, rejecting a claim by Arkansas prison officials that inmates could hide contraband in facial hair.

In ruling for inmate Gregory Holt, who now goes by Abdul Maalik Muhammad, Justice Samuel Alito drew heavily on his 2014 Hobby Lobby opinion that granted for-profit businesses a religious exemption from...
